parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To deal craftily with, outwit. Middle voice from kata and sophizo; to be crafty against, i.e. Circumvent.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Offspring, family, race, nation, kind. From ginomai; 'kin'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To treat badly, afflict, embitter, make angry. From kakos; to injure; figuratively, to exasperate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
(a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
Cast out, exposed (to the elements), abandoned. From ek and a derivative of tithemi; put out, i.e. Exposed to perish.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Infant, babe, child in arms. Of uncertain affinity; an infant literally or figuratively.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From the same as zoon and a derivative of ginomai; to engender alive, i.e. to rescue from death.
